item.title: Deep Work
item.description: Cal Newport’s Deep Work discusses the increasing rarity and also value in the ability to work deeply. It has inspired me to reflect a bit on the role that mindfulness and distraction play in daily life. At work, much of my contribution relies on my ability to share information with others or to participate in peer review. It seems as though it would be either difficult or hypocritical to focus on my efforts without participating in the distracting, ad-hoc nature of this work.
